column5: Interesting camp. I decided to look into it a bit. It is located on Winkle Lake, which has pike, bass, and lake trout, no walleye. For crappie and walleye, trips to other nearby waters are suggested. Being sort of in the middle of the bush, it could be a good time, if you don't mind running to other vicinity lakes. I'm guessing it was once a fly-in, apparently camp is run on propane, and a generator(s?) is used for battery charging, i may be wrong on this, but that was what I surmised from the reading. Still, it looks like a neat place, getting to it with reduced driving as a benefit. Bill
pretty rustic, propane stove and lights, 2 cabins have electricity for cpap's. Beds could use replacements
Just a FWIW - back then - they also had gas pumps in that old location.........

I'm sure many are like myself who have passed this place many times driving the 502 up to Dryden and wondered "I wonder what that place is like". I wanted to do a quick trip and test out the crossing procedures at the border, Glad I did. TWL offers many options for species, You can fish for crappies, Huge Small/Largemouth Bass, Big pike and eater walleyes. I opted for 2 days of backcountry remote fishing guided. small 14' boat put us in some lakes that probably only get fished a few times a yr. 1st day caught about 100 12-15'' crappies in the morning, then off to another lake for Smallies, 2nd day, consisted of largemouth bass and a few pike. All in all it was a great 2 days and was nice to be in Canada again. A return to Eagle Lake is only 3 weeks away
man i bet that was fun!
Iâ€™m sure that was fun, hard to beat a good crappie bite.
Looks like a lot of fun. Thanks for the report.

On a funny side note, we drove by the office for this place for years and never saw signs of life. It used to be out by the highway. One trip I had to stop for my buddy to urinate. I pulled over and he was hanging it out going when all of the sudden a woman bursts out of the place swearing about us savage Americans. My poor buddy could hardly keep from going on himself. Not sure if this is true but we heard that when they sold it, the building was in the right of way and they knew it. After the new owners got it they found out the hard way and had to move it.
This happened at least 15 or so years ago.
